definition: big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
individual/this/that/size/classifier for people or objects in general
variant of 人[ren2]/"person" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 10), occurring in 兒, 兀, 兄 etc
stupid great hulk of a man

sentences.english: The big dragoon was as helpless as a baby.
sentences.chinese: 这龙骑兵大个儿象婴儿似的毫无办法。

sentences.english: Battle, in order to save a little girl, big heroic sacrifice.
sentences.chinese: 战斗中，大个儿为了救一个小女孩，壮烈牺牲了。

sentences.english: The big man crowded the child out of his way.
sentences.chinese: 那个大个儿将小孩挤开。

sentences.english: It's usually the big guy who's alone in the corner.
sentences.chinese: 通常是大个儿独自在角落里。

sentences.english: Ross: It felt like a 'big guy' moment.
Large hail was banging into cars and windows.
sentences.chinese: 大个儿的冰雹落入轿车中，落入窗户中。

sentences.english: Mark Cuban's best player is still a tall gawky German guy.
sentences.chinese: 马克库班的最好的球员依然是那个迟钝的德国大个儿。

sentences.english: How pretty, I want a big one.
sentences.chinese: 好可爱啊，我要买一个大个儿的。

sentences.english: Give me some apples . I want big ones.
sentences.chinese: 给我一些苹果，我要大个儿的。

definition: stupid great hulk of a man
a person of short stature/a short person
(coll.) short, fat person (esp. a kid)/a roly-poly
wooden club (used to beat clothes in washing)
